title: John Zorn Discography 1973 - 2013 - part 1 of 3
description:
John Zorn Discography 1973 - 2013 - part 1 of 3


Dig the genius of John Zorn
 <a href="
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Zorn" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Zorn</a>

In the far 90s, I often assisted at jazz gigs in my city clubs...
And it was there that I learned about the existence of John Zorn...
I remember a music agent, dealing with hard bop artists. He was talking with his mates before a gig and he uttered: 
"Dont talk to me about that big pile of shit that is John Zorn... This is not jazz ... this is blasphemy..."
And I wondered: "Wow... Who is this John Zorn capable to trigger such violent reactions... he must be an interesting dude..."

And it was. The poor agent, tied to classic jazz, couldnt conceive how music can be disassembled and rebuilt in new ways.
John Zorn, the Wandering Jew, is a full round and versatile artist.
From earaching avantgarde to kletzmerizing atmospheres, from classic jazz to electronica, even from alternative rock to grindcore.
Putting together this discography I was intrigued by the many paths, the many artists related to Zorn.
Probably this is not a complete discography and it will bee soon outdated due to his usual prolificity.
This wants to be simply a compendium. You will find here both his main production and the many collaborations I was able to discover and find.

The resulting discography (280 album) is too big even for my usual enciclopedic standards so I split it in three parts.
This is the first part.

All the album are zipped (since the number of files was too high for TPB).
The sampling rate is 320kbps when possible.
Different rates are signed in the name of the albums zips.

Enjoy :)
